grammar.summary: itek is a line-oriented, indentation-based language for writing resumes that transpiles to LaTeX.

constructs.description: Document declaration. Must be the first non-empty line.
Section header (normalized to lowercase). Known sections: socials, education, experience, leadership, skills, projects. Unknown sections render using experience-style layout if they have entries.
Field. Value can be plain, quoted ("value"), or a URL/email wrapped in angle brackets (<url>).
Entry marker. 'company' for #experience/#leadership, 'project' for #projects, 'organization' for #leadership. A colon after the marker is optional.
Generic entry. Works in any section as an alternative to semantic markers.

socials.description: Contact info rendered in the header. No entries, only fields.

fields.number: Phone number. Auto-formatted to (XXX) XXX-XXXX if exactly 10 digits.
fields.email: Email address. Wrap in <> for mailto link: email: <user@example.com>
fields.linkedin: LinkedIn URL. Wrap in <> for hyperlink.
fields.github: GitHub URL. Wrap in <> for hyperlink.
fields.website: Personal website URL. Wrap in <> for hyperlink.
fields.portfolio: Portfolio URL. Wrap in <> for hyperlink.

education.description: Education section. Can use entries (## <School>) or flat fields directly under the section.

fields.school: School name (only used in flat mode, otherwise the entry name is the school).
fields.gpa: GPA. Appended to degree line as '; GPA: X.XX'.
fields.courses: Relevant coursework. Alias: coursework. Rendered as a bullet point.

education.example:
#education
  ## Rice University
    loc: Houston, TX
    degree: B.S. Computer Science
    gpa: 3.8
    grad: May 2025
    courses: Data Structures, Algorithms, OS

experience.example:
#experience
  company Google
    role: Software Engineer Intern
    loc: Mountain View, CA
    date: Jun 2024 -- Aug 2024
    * Built a microservice handling 10K requests/sec
    * Reduced latency by 30% through caching

leadership.description: Leadership section. Same layout as experience.
leadership.example:
#leadership
  organization Rice CS Club
    role: President
    loc: Houston, TX
    date: Aug 2023 -- May 2024
    * Led a team of 15 officers

projects.description: Projects section. Uses a compact heading with optional tech stack.

fields.stack: Technologies used. Aliases: technologies, tech. Rendered in italics next to project name.

projects.example:
#projects
  project ChatApp
    stack: React, Node.js, WebSocket
    date: Jan 2024
    * Real-time messaging with 500+ concurrent users
    * End-to-end encrypted using libsodium

skills.description: Technical skills section. Key-value pairs only, no entries or bullets.

fields.<any key>: Any key-value pair. Common keys: languages, frameworks, technologies, tools, databases.

skills.example:
#skills
  languages: Python, Java, C++, JavaScript
  frameworks: React, Flask, Spring Boot
  tools: Git, Docker, AWS, Linux

specialBehaviors.urlParsing: Values wrapped in <angle brackets> are parsed as URLs/emails. They produce hyperlinks in the PDF.
specialBehaviors.phoneFormatting: Phone numbers with exactly 10 digits are auto-formatted to (XXX) XXX-XXXX.
specialBehaviors.latexEscaping: Special LaTeX characters (\, &, %, $, #, _, {, }, ~, ^) are auto-escaped in the generated LaTeX.
specialBehaviors.genericEntries: ## <Name> works as an entry in any section, as an alternative to semantic markers like 'company' or 'project'.
specialBehaviors.unknownSections: Sections not in the known list are rendered using the experience-style layout if they contain entries.
specialBehaviors.indentation: Indentation is for readability only â€” the parser trims all lines. Structure is determined by line prefixes, not nesting.
